elements.text: PART ONE
1: NARRATION
GRAMS: ‘GAME OF THRONES’ TYPE MUSIC.
Once, long ago, in a land of monsters and corridors, a fair maiden was captured, and placed in a deep sleep.
She was used to being captured, and she had a hero who rescued her on just such occasions. But this time the hero never came. And the fair maiden slept on.
Eventually, a King rescued the maiden, and made her his bride, which many wise old women might that tell you is just another way of capturing fair maidens.
And still the fair maiden slept on.
Then, the hero had another stab at rescuing the maiden from her prison, but he was too late, and more importantly, he had forgotten the rules of fairy tales.
He didn’t slay the dragon.
GRAMS: OPENING THEME
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 3
2: INT. PALACE — OUTER CORRIDORS
FX: FOOTSTEPS.
#1: Halt! Who goes there?
#2: (APPROACHING) It’s me.
#1: Say the thing.
#2: Oh come on... You know who I am.
#1: You’re not getting past without saying the thing.
#2: (SIGH) “Long live King Yrcanos.”
#1: You can’t be too careful. Not at this time of dire portents.
#2: What portents?
#1: Dire ones. And dread visions as well. Look, just take my word for it. Things are abroad. Signs are in the air.
#2: Don’t tell me about the tree again.
#1: It was shaped exactly like Hubris the Prophet.
#2: It had swallowed Hubris the Prophet. It was a flesh-eating death shrub.

For your information, oh cynical one, I actually heard a dread portent just this minute. The cry of the War God. It sent chills into my very soul.. It was a sort of euuugh! Euurggh! noise. — No. Actually, more like a vwoooorp, vwoooorrrp.
You idiot. I heard it too. It was the call of a bull Gorgadillo on the first night of middens’ eve, heralding the fact the crops are going to be a bit dodgy this season.
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 4
#1: Now who’s delusional? It was the War God!
#2: It was a Gorgadillo, you twit!
(APPROACHING) Gentlemen, gentlemen, please desist. I can’t bear to see guards squabbling when they should be guarding.
#1: Who are you?
I am a travelling expert on unusual and portentous noises.
#2: Ooh. That’s lucky.
Allow me to settle your squabble. I believe the sound you heard was not a God, or a Gorgadillo. It was nothing less than the mighty engine of an incredibly sophisticated inter-dimensional craft.
#2: Not a portent then.
Ah, but it is the best type of portent. It is a portent that a hero of infinite wisdom is coming here, to the planet Krontep. A Time Lord.

Time Lord? Hang on, wait a minute.. let me get my notes out. (PULLS NOTE OUT OF POCKET; READS) “Expect an incredibly sophisticated craft... blah... inter-dimensional.. blah... coat...” Oh yeah! “Time Lord, calls himself ‘the Doctor...’”
That’s me. I’m glad I’m expected.
#2: (KNOWING) Oh yeah. You’re expected, alright.
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 5
3: INT. PALACE CORRIDORS (FEW MOMENTS LATER
FX: ALARM KLAXON.
STOPPING, PANTING HEAVILY
#2: (BEHIND, RUNNING TO STOP) There he is!
#1: (BEHIND) Stop! Or we fire!
(BREATHLESS, CALLING BACK) Gentlemen, there must be some mistake. My invitation must have been lost in the post...
FX: BLASTER FIRE.
I do tend to move around a lot. Perhaps you could check the guest list?
FX: BLASTER FIRE.
I think I’m probably sitting on the bride’s side. (RUNS OFF, GUARDS IN PURSUIT)
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 6
4: INT. PERI’S CHAMBER
FX: DISTANT ALARMS. KNOCK ON DOOR.
Come!
FX: DOOR OPENS. THROUGH IT WE HEAR:
#1: (OFF) I think I saw him over there!
OFF) No! Over there! (THEY RUN
(CLEARS THROAT) Your Highness. I thought you ought to know, the Doctor’s here.
Thank you, Wolsey. I kind of guessed from the alarms and the shouting and the gunfire.
I’ve got the men searching top to bottom. He won’t get far.
Good. Thank you, Wolsey.
I aim to serve, Ma’am.
Oh, and Wolsey.
Yes, Ma’am?
He’s really not a bad person, once you get to know him.
I’m sure he’s not, Ma’am. (EXITS)
FX: DOOR SLAM. BEAT.
(MUFFLED) Has he gone?
Yes, you can come out now.
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 7
FX: RUSTLE OF SKIRTS.
I’ve never hidden under a wedding dress before. But it was bound to happen eventually. Hello, Peri.
Hello Doctor.
I... appear not to have been invited to your wedding.
No, you weren’t.

I see. That explains it. I did search for an invitation. Anything from you, in fact. A note. A letter. Something. I spent quite a long time looking in the ruins of Thoros Beta, but I never did find a message.
The fact I left with Yrcanos without waiting to say goodbye. That was your message.
Oh.
Do you get the message now?
Painfully, yes I do.
So why are you here, Doctor? It’s really not a good time. I’m changing for the reception.
Well, as you say, you’re very busy, I’m not sure I should burden you [with]
(INTERRUPTING) Don’t tell me. You’ve left another of your companions for dead, and you came to persuade me to rejoin you in your travels because you felt a bit lonely?
FX: DUB IN FLASHBACK — DOCTOR REMEMBERS CLOSING MOMENTS OF
‘SCAVENGER’ :
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 8
. Alright, here goes nothing. [...] India or bust, Doctor...!
JUMPS
Not... quite...
BREATHING IN ANTICIPATION, THEN LAUNCHES HERSELF DOWN
Wuuuuuuaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaargh!
FX: QUICK ECHO OUT OF FLASHBACK.
I can see in your eyes that I’m in the ballpark. I bet you thought you could dip into my life again, a quick spin around the galaxy, and get me home for the cutting of the cake.
I do understand how you feel, Peri, but...
Explain to me how I feel, Doctor. Please do.
FX: BEHIND DOOR, GUARDS GO BY.
[GUARD #2: What about this way? (RUNNING)
#1: What about that way? (STOP; BEAT; RUNNING OPPOSITE DIRECTION) ]
Right at this moment? Things are very pressing... I’ll explain later.
Not this time, Doctor. You’1ll explain now. Right here. Right now.
I presume you’re angry because I failed to rescue you from Thoros Beta. Well, can I just say that wasn’t intentional? — There’s actually a funny story attached to that...
You abandoned me and left me to die!
Look, there’s no need to part on such bad terms. At least let me give you a lift to Earth; just one trip. Or you can bring your family here for the wedding...?
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 9

No, Doctor. I’m not coming with you. No adventures, no escape. No lift home, because that would give you the tiniest crumb of comfort; that by accepting your help, I’ve in some small way forgiven you for nearly letting me die. And I haven’t. And I’m not giving you what you want. Not this time.
Please, Peri. I know you still believe in me. I heard you say I wasn’t a bad person, once you got to know me.
(CALLING OFF) Wolsey?
(BEHIND DOOR) Right here, Ma’am.
You can come in now.
FX: DOOR OPENS.
“He’s not really a bad person once you get to know him” is actually our code phrase, meaning: “The Doctor is here, please apprehend him when I give the order.”
Come on, Doctor — move.
Peri!

Go on Doctor, off you go, off to the cells, and then you can wait a few minutes, do a little trick with a thingamajig, and you can escape, and disappear into the night, and we never have to see each other for the rest of our lives.
I won’t let it end like this, Peri.
FX: DOOR CLOSES. FOLLOW DOCTOR AND WOLSEY AS THEY WALK OUT INTO
THE CORRIDOR.
Don’t give me any trouble, Doctor.
Perish the thought. — I presume the cells are down here?
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 10
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 11
5: NARRATION
The Doctor stayed in his cell and refused to escape. The guest who wouldn’t leave, even after the chairs were stacked and the wedding presents were all hung up in the armoury.
I did not visit him until seven days after the wedding...
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 12
6: INT. DUNGEON
FX: HEAVY DOOR OPENS.
Ah, Constable Wolsey. Good morning. Or is it evening? It’s difficult to tell down here.
You Guards — on your way. There’s a code black emergency. Report to the main hall.
#1 & #2: Yes, sir!
FX: GUARDS EXIT DOWN OUTSIDE CORRIDOR.
I want a word with you, Doctor.
Do you have an appointment? I’m a very busy man. I’m teaching the Guards how to play Yahtzee this afternoon. They really are delightful. Do you know their names?
No, I don’t.

I would have thought as their Commander you’d have taken an interest, but.. The taller Guard is Guard One, and the shorter one is Guard Two. They’re brothers. Their family have been in the guarding business for generations. Their mother thought it would save confusion to name them Guard One and Guard Two, to make things easy for any busy commander-at-arms they’d inevitably serve under. Mothers are wonderful, [aren’t they?]
King Yrcanos is dead.
What?
Yrcanos is dead.
Oh. Oh dear. I’m very sorry. He was a brave and noble warrior. How is Queen Peri taking it?
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 13
Well, we’ve just finished clearing away the royal reception and now she’s going to have to organise a royal funeral.
Thrift, thrift, Horatio. The wedding meat can coldly furnish the funeral tables.. Alas, poor Yrcanos. — So how did he finally
go to the Hall of his Gods? No doubt he was busy slicing through his enemies like luncheon meat [and got unlucky]
He was poisoned.
Poisoned?! That’s hardly the way he would have wanted to go. — Hold on, are you here because you suspect me?
No, unfortunately.
Good, because I’ve had enough trials and sentences of death to last several lifetimes.

Someone slipped him Trimorphol. It’s a genetically manufactured poison that you can programme to kill your victim at a time of your choosing. This particular dose was programmed to take exactly ten days.. then, bam! He was gone.
How terrible.
I was wondering if you could apply that legendary intellect of yours to helping me find out who?
I’1l do what I can.
I have a theory. I think the murderer wanted to keep Yrcanos alive long enough to get married, so on his death, the throne would transfer to his Queen.
Ah. You think someone wanted to wait a while, woo the Queen, marry her, and take the Crown.
Exactly.
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 14
Ten days you say.. What was Yrcanos doing ten days ago?
He was leaving for his stag night, hunting Varneks in the Hinterlands with several prominent galactic nobles. Here’s the list of who went hunting with him.
FX: RUSTLE OF PAPER.
Baron Pteratravrk...
He was the one who kept moulting over the bridesmaids. He’s always had ambitions to take over this part of space. Same with the Reverend Flitamus, but he’s more of a religious fanatic.
(READING) ‘Prince Harcross the Ever-patient...’
Harcross is not an empire-builder, but he’s developed a thing for Queen Peri. Apparently, if you go to his castle there are busts of her everywhere.
I see. And having such deadly rivals invited to a stag night and a wedding wasn’t seen as risky in any way?
It’s politics, Doctor. If he didn’t invite them it would have been war, guaranteed.
Well, Mr Wolsey, this seems an intriguing problem. You will need to interview all these suspects, of course. Are they attending the funeral?
No. They’ve all been called away on urgent business on their respective homeworlds.
How convenient.
I thought that.
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 15

I suggest we save time and use my TARDIS to investigate them. When Queen Peri has recovered from her grief, perhaps she’d like to accompany us? I’m sure she could provide valuable insights into each of them.
That might be awkward. Queen Peri is not taking part in these investigations.

Not taking part? Her husband has been murdered! The Peri I know would not rest until she found the murderer! I’m only amazed she’s not in here right now helping us work out our — [strategy] (BEAT) She doesn’t know you’re here, does she?
No.
She doesn’t even know you’re talking to me.
No, she doesn’t.
So, can I take it from the secret nature of this conversation, that she hasn’t requested my help?
No.
I’1l thank you to leave this cell, Constable Wolsey.
Doctor...

Wolsey, let me explain the rules, because you seem to have forgotten them. Peri is the Queen, I am her unpardoned prisoner and you are my jailer. There is a feudal hierarchy here that you tamper with at your peril. We must all know our place in this kingdom.
Yes, but [even so]
Kindly close the door on your way out, you’ll leave a draught.
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 16
7: NARRATION
GRAMS: ‘GAME OF THRONES’ MUSIC.
The Doctor was adamant that he would not leave his cell without forgiveness from his Queen, and she was equally adamant that she would not give it.
I conducted enquiries into the death of the King, but my investigations came to nothing, and Yrcanos passed into history.

Five years went by, and still the Doctor did not attempt to escape. Every time I checked on him there he was, sitting innocently on his chaise-longue, reading his books and listening to his gramophone.

As the years passed, his cheery presence unnerved me. Once I even left the door of his cell open, hoping that he’d go quietly, but come the morning he was still there. He had fashioned a crude key using old finger bones, teeth and paper clips and locked the door for me.
Then, five years later...
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 17
8: INT. DUNGEON/CORRIDOR
FX: KEYS. CELL DOOR OPENS.
Ah, Constable. Good to see you [again. ]
Guards! Escort the Doctor out.
#1: Alright, Doctor. On your feet.
Good to see you again, Guard One. How’s the old trouble?
#1: Much better, Doctor, thanks to your magic fingers. I can raise my spear above my head again. Couldn’t do that a month ago.
FX: DOOR SHUT BEHIND. ALL BEGIN WALKING DOWN CORRIDOR.
Splendid. And how are the little ones, Guard Two?
#2: Oh, they’re fantastic, Doctor. Guard Four has just broken his first tooth and Guard Three has just started Guarding School.
Doesn’t time fly.
#2: Yeah. She’1ll be starting to patrol before you know it.
Tell them they’1ll have a little surprise in their snowboots come Hogmas day.
#2: Aww, you spoil them, Doctor.
Can we have a bit little of dignity, please? We are meant to be prisoner and escorts here.
#1 & #2: Sorry, sir.
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL)
Can I ask where we’re going?
You'll see.
FX: WALK OFF. CUT TO:
Page 18
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 19
9: INT. SPACE DOCK
FX: AIRLOCK-STYLE MECHANICAL DOOR OPENS. DOCTOR, GUARDS AND
EMERGE INTO AN ECHOEY SPACE DOCK.
My goodness. That’s quite a craft.
That’s the Royal Scoutship. The Sword of Peace. It was christened by Queen Peri herself. Of course, in the old days of Yreanos it was called The Spirit of Utmost Belligerence.
Ah, dear old Yrcanos. He never changed, did he?
You never gave him enough credit, Doctor. He was always open- minded when it came to new technology. Open-minded enough to authorise the use of Crozier’s research to augment me into a sheep.
Yes, I’m not sure why you were made into a sheep, Wolsey.
I’ve got four stomachs now. Good for a policeman. When I get a gut feeling, I really get a gut feeling.
FX: SCOUTSHIP HATCH OPENS. PERI WALKS DOWN METAL GANGPLANK.
Welcome aboard, Doctor.
Peri! I’m.. glad to see you. You look well.
Thanks. You 1ook... well...
AWKWARD PAUSE
I’m sorry about Yrcanos.
So am I.
AWKWARD PAUSE
I’m sorry you’ve been in our dungeon for five years.
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 20
(WITH FEELING) So am I.
Look... I want to say something.
I’d like to say something too.
Okay, you first.
I just want to say I’m really, truly sorry for what happened on Thoros Beta. And if there’s any way I can make amends...
. I know that. I think I’ve always known. That’s why I want to apologise for not asking you to help investigate Yrcanos’s murder.
I know that it will take time to forgive me. I had faith in you, Peri. Please have faith in me.
Doctor. I hereby pardon you and hope you pardon me in return. I humbly request you sit at my right hand as the Queen’s Adviser.
FX: LINKING MUSIC.
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 21
10: INT. SCOUTSHIP CORRIDOR (IN FLIGHT
FX: WALKING IN SHIP.
I don’t like involving the Doctor, Ma’am.
Why not?

The late King had many stories about the Doctor. Some of them good, some of them.. Well, I don’t like to speak ill of your friend, but from all accounts he was volatile. Able to switch Sides and betray his allies when the mood took him.
That was only my husband’s experience of him, Wolsey. The Doctor I remember was... eccentric at times, yes, but a noble soul, always willing to fight on behalf of the underdog.
I don’t like dogs. They worry me.
Perhaps you should debrief the Doctor. Tell him where we’re going. It’ll give you a chance to get to know him better.
Hmph.
Oh, go on. You know how you like debriefings. — I’1l let you use the holographic visualiser...?
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 22
11: INT. SCOUTSHIP — CONFERENCE ROOM (IN FLIGHT
FX: BUTTON. SHIMMER AS IMAGE POPS UP.
This is Baron Pteratrark. Ruler of Terterra. Very fond of duelling, and having his honour offended. Can start a war over a dropped napkin. Known associates:
FX: BUTTON. SHIMMER.
Him in the mask. Surgeon Tocrodi. A military doctor who restrains Baron Pteratrark’s more bloodthirsty excesses.
FX: BUTTON. SHIMMER.

This is Reverend Flitamus of Chiroptera. As Head of State, he likes to think himself defender of all faiths. He changes his religion every morning and launches crusades against anyone who wears the wrong type of hat. Known associates:
FX: BUTTON. SHIMMER.
The cowled gentleman is Drast, an acolyte who literally refuses to step outside Flitamus’s shadow.
FX: BUTTON. SHIMMER.
Now we come to Prince Harcross the Ever-P— (EXASPERATION) Doctor, will you pay attention!
Sorry, but is this really necessary? I don’t really work like
this. I tend to dive into my adventures, and rely on my wits...
Humour me.
FX: BUTTON. SHIMMER.
This is the planet Hurn.
Very pretty.
I suppose you’ve been there.
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 23
Several times.
Shall I carry on?
Please do.
(SIGHS) Population six million, mainly agrarian. A peaceful and friendly planet, on the whole.
My goodness! Did you say peaceful and friendly?
Yes. What’s so important about that?
Nothing. I’m just humouring you.
FX: DOOR OPENS.
(GRITTED TEETH) As I was saying... Hurn is on the verge of joining the Tantross Coalition.
(ENTERING) And that is why I’ve been invited as a royal observer, Doctor. Princess Dirani is choosing her husband out of a number of possible suitors.
Ah. And would their number include Baron Pteratrark, Reverend Flitamus and Prince Harcross, by any chance?

All three have made offers of marriage to me over the years, and now, frustrated with my rebuttals, they have settled their Sights on the Princess. No doubt hoping sweet words and expensive trinkets will turn their small empires into larger ones.
I’ve provided detailed biogs for each of the suspects.
There’s really no need, Wolsey. I have conducted a little research of my own.
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 24
What do you mean by that?
I’1ll explain later.
I can’t wait.
Landfall in fifteen minutes, gentlemen. (AS SHE EXITS) Smarten yourselves up, we’ve a Royal Banquet to attend...
FX: LINKING MUSIC.
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 25
9: INT. BIG HALL
FX: FADE UP. ECHOING. MURMURING OF CROWD.
No matter how many times I come here, Doctor, I can never get over how big this hall is. It was constructed around the skeleton of a fully-grown Megaptera.
How distasteful.
But you must admit it’s incredibly impressive.
Impressively distasteful, yes.
(BOOMING FROM ACROSS HALL) Pray be upstanding, delegates, for the Princess is on her way to the Hall.
FX: SQUEAL OF CHAIRS AS CROWD STAND UP AS ONE.
NB: THE DOCTOR AND PERI SPEAK IN LOW VOICES THROUGHOUT.
Peri, I have a confession to make.
Can’t it wait? Princess Dirani is about to make her address.
No, I have to say this. When I came to see you five years ago... You were right.
About what?
I WAS lonely. I had recently lost a friend. And that experience made me want to see you, in the hope I hadn’t lost you too. Truth to tell, I was afraid of what I might discover.
You? Afraid?
I knew you might have been angry, but I didn’t expect you to leave with Yrcanos. I thought you would have at least waited for me. A week. Even a day.
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 26
Doctor... sometimes, when we humans feel our lives are going in the wrong direction, we just need to decide to change it. I expect you’ve never had that urge.
I understand. That’s why I’m roaming the universe instead of cataloguing Gallifreyan data coils.
When Yrcanos saved me I just thought, ‘This is my chance to get away from you.’
(LOUD) Get away? But — we had such fun!
SHUSHES DOCTOR

(LOW VOICE) Remember when I shoved the Borad into the Timelash? And that time when we went fishing for Gumblejack? Oh, and remember when I performed that card trick for the Hydrads, so they got confused and tied their heads together? And who could forget when we danced around those Monoids until they collapsed of dizziness?
(LOW VOICE) As If I could forget!
(LOUD) Those Monoids had an eye for you, Peri.
Do be quiet, sir!
I’m just talking to my friend here!
FX: FANFARE. CROWD CONVERSATIONS DIE DOWN. CROSS TO TOP OF
HALL.
Pray silence for Princess Dirani, regent of Hurn. May none cough, chat amongst themselves, or allow their mobile communication devices to sound, while her majesty is speaking.
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 27

Honoured guests. Welcome to Hurn. I will not make a long speech, for we are all aware of the reason we are here. I know that many of you are eager to pledge their troth to me. As you can see standing at the edge of the room are servants with scrolls, and if you give your names to them you will be allocated a ten-minute window, during such time you can make your pitch. Those I select will be put through to throne camp and thence to the live final at Hurn Cathedral.
But all of that is for tomorrow. I know many of you have come many light years, and you must be very tired. I will take my leave of you now. Please eat, drink and retire to your quarters.
FX: FANFARE AS DIRANI EXITS. ASSEMBLED DELEGATES SIT AND START
EATING. CROSS BACK TO DOCTOR AND PERI.
Look over there. There’s Baron Pteratrark.
(OFF) Come, Tocrodi. Let us drink until we argue with the furniture and find ourselves unable to count our own feet.
(OFF) Ha! You talk like a girl, Baron. Let us drink until we argue with our feet and use each other as furniture.
(OFF) Ha!
(OFF) Ha!
The masked man with him is Surgeon Tocrodi, loyal friend of the Baron. — And over there, skulking in the shadows, is Reverend Flitamus, and the character in that cowl is his acolyte, Drast.
(OFF) Would you like some rat scratchings, Reverend?
(OFF) I will decline on this occasion, Drast. But you pop open a bag if our current God wills you eat.
So you do this a lot, do you, Peri? Going from planet to planet? Being a royal observer?
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 28

Since my husband died, yes. I felt I had a calling to go and work as an ambassador to spread peace. If there’s conflict between warlords, I go with my entourage to seek them out and try and avoid bloodshed.
So you’re a sort of... relationship counsellor?
I guess you could put it like that, [yes.]
(OFF, OUTRAGED) Godless, feckless deviant — you deliberately brushed past me!
Hello. What’s going on over there...?
FX: CROSS TO ANOTHER PART OF HALL:
“Brush past you” I did not!
You allowed your unclean feathers to touch my holy cloak.
How dare you insult me?! — I will ruffle my plumage at you ina disdainful manner.
Typical of a Pteratrark. Do you not see how you insult the Princess by your presence?
Oh, yeah, she was so insulted. She just looked at me like she wanted me. And then I undressed her with my eyes.
You dare to undress the Princess Dirani with your eyes?
I dare!
I will not rise to this.
No-one turns their back on Baron Pteratrark! Prepare to die!
FX: SHOVE, TABLES, CHAIRS SCATTERED.
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 29
You are up against a master now, Flitamus. Not one of those peasants you burn at the stake...
FX: SWORDS CLASHING — LUNGE, PARRY. CROSS BACK TO DOCTOR/PERI.
They’re very volatile, aren’t they?
You should see them at weekends. I’m amazed they haven’t vaporised each other’s empires by now.
FX: CROSS BACK TO FIGHT.
(SWORDFIGHTING) I am the finest swordsmen in Terterra — aren’t I, Tocrodi? Tell him!
The Baron is the finest swordsmen in Terterra.
(SWORDFIGHTING) There, I told you...
(SWORDFIGHTING) I have God on my side. — Which God am I worshipping today, Drast?
Today? Zorn the Vengeful.
(SWORDFIGHTING) Oh good, one of the violent ones.
FX: CROSS BACK TO DOCTOR/PERI.
Perhaps we should get out of here. Wouldn’t want to be impaled by a stray rapier on my first day out of prison. That would be most embarrassing.
Don’t worry Doctor, they’ll be engaging the anti-gravity fields any moment [now. ]
FX: OFF — FORCE FIELD ACTIVATED.
& FLITAMUS:
OFF — CRY AS THEY ARE LIFTED INTO THE AIR
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 30
FX: OFF — SWORDS CLATTER TO GROUND.
(OFF) What outrage is this?
(OFF) Release us at once!
They’1ll be hanging off the ceiling for hours.
Won’t they mind?
It’s all just macho posturing. I’m sure they hope it’1ll be reported to the Princess Dirani, and it’1ll be enough to get them through to the next round.
Peri. What I said earlier. You’re not just using me to find a murderer, are you?
I don’t know what you mean. Why else would I want you here?
I need to know. There is still a part of you who is still... my friend. You are my friend, aren’t you Peri?
A PAUSE
I.. Doctor, I... I.. don’t feel so good. I need to lie down.
Of course. (SHOUTING) Make way. Queen Peri is unwell! Move out of the way, nothing to see here!
FX: BUSY BUSTLING OFF. FADE.
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 31

PTERATRARK: Oh, yeah, she was so insulted. She just looked at me like she wanted me. And then I undressed her with my eyes.
FLITAMUS: You dare to undress the Princess Dirani with your eyes?
PTERATRARK: I dare!
FLITAMUS: I will not rise to this.
PTERATRARK: No-one turns their back on Baron Pteratrark! Prepare to die!
PTERATRARK: THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 29
PTERATRARK: You are up against a master now, Flitamus. Not one of those peasants you burn at the stake...
DOCTOR: They’re very volatile, aren’t they?
PERI: You should see them at weekends. I’m amazed they haven’t vaporised each other’s empires by now.
PTERATRARK: (SWORDFIGHTING) I am the finest swordsmen in Terterra — aren’t I, Tocrodi? Tell him!
TOCRODI: The Baron is the finest swordsmen in Terterra.
PTERATRARK: (SWORDFIGHTING) There, I told you...
FLITAMUS: (SWORDFIGHTING) I have God on my side. — Which God am I worshipping today, Drast?
DRAST: Today? Zorn the Vengeful.
FLITAMUS: (SWORDFIGHTING) Oh good, one of the violent ones.
DOCTOR: Perhaps we should get out of here. Wouldn’t want to be impaled by a stray rapier on my first day out of prison. That would be most embarrassing.
PERI: Don’t worry Doctor, they’ll be engaging the anti-gravity fields any moment [now. ]
PTERATRARK: & FLITAMUS:
PTERATRARK: THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 30
PTERATRARK: (OFF) What outrage is this?
FLITAMUS: (OFF) Release us at once!
PERI: They’1ll be hanging off the ceiling for hours.
DOCTOR: Won’t they mind?
PERI: It’s all just macho posturing. I’m sure they hope it’1ll be reported to the Princess Dirani, and it’1ll be enough to get them through to the next round.
DOCTOR: Peri. What I said earlier. You’re not just using me to find a murderer, are you?
PERI: I don’t know what you mean. Why else would I want you here?
DOCTOR: I need to know. There is still a part of you who is still... my friend. You are my friend, aren’t you Peri?
PERI: I.. Doctor, I... I.. don’t feel so good. I need to lie down.
DOCTOR: Of course. (SHOUTING) Make way. Queen Peri is unwell! Move out of the way, nothing to see here!
DOCTOR: THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 31
GUARD: #1: (EXPERIMENTING) Long live QUEEN Perpugilliam.. Long LIVE Queen Perpugilliam. Yes, it might work...
DOCTOR: (WALKING UP) Good day to you, Guards. How goes the day?
GUARD: #1: Good, thanks Doctor.
GUARD: #2: We’ve upgraded. Got a new password.
GUARD: #1:
LONG: live Queen Perpugilliam!
DOCTOR: Marvellous! I think Constable Wolsey needs you in the guest quarters. Queen Peri has retired to her chamber for the night with a bit of a dicky tummy.
GUARD: #2: Nothing serious, I hope?
DOCTOR: Oh no. I’m sure it’s nothing.
WOLSEY: (RUNNING UP) Detain that man! Don’t let him get away!
GUARD: #1: What man?
DOCTOR: Ah, I think he means me...
WOLSEY: The Doctor! (ARRIVING) Arrest him, you fools!
GUARD: #2: The Doctor?
WOLSEY: Hold him! Grab his arms!
DOCTOR: I think you’d better hold me tighter than that, boys. The Constable seems very cross.
DOCTOR: THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 32
WOLSEY: Queen Peri trusted you, Doctor, and this is how you repay her.
GUARD: #1: (LOW VOICE) What’s he going on about?
GUARD: #2: (LOW VOICE) Dunno.
WOLSEY: Doctor, I am arresting you for the murder of Queen Perpugilliam.
DOCTOR: Oh dear. I knew you were going to say that.
WOLSEY: Really? Then you will know that I will shortly execute you in accordance with the maximum penalty specified in Galactic charter twelve, concerning treason and regicide!
GUARD: #1: I think we’re going to need another password.
GUARD: END OF PART ONE
GUARD: THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 33

elements.text: PART TWO
NO REPRISE
11: INT. ANTECHAMBER
(STRIDING IN) Flunkey, let me pass! I desire an audience with the Princess Dirani.
Sorry, Constable, she’s busy. (FX: SCROLL UNFURLED) She’s currently interviewing... (READING) The first sea-sponge of the Anemone tribes, the Prince Most-—Deepest-All-Yellow.
When will she be finished?
He only just went in. But by the look of him, I don’t think he’ll be in there very long.
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 34
12: INT. THRONE ROOM
(MECHANICAL TRANSLATOR FX) Greetings to you, Princess.
And to you, Prince Most-Deepest-All-Yellow.
Your skin is like the deepest and most blue-green parts of my kingdom. The parts that we excrete in for great fortune.
Oh, that’s very...
Please allow me to break off a piece of myself, as a gift to you.
FX: TEARING OFF BIT OF CORAL.
Put it on a dish of water on your windowsill, and it will grow into another me.
(TAKING CORAL) Lovely.
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL)
13: INT. ANTECHAMBER
FX: AUTOMATED DOOR OPENS.
A ‘no’ from the Princess, was it?
(EXITING) It was a ‘no’.
FX: AS HE SQUELCHES OFF:
Sorry to hear that, your Highness.
CLEARS THROAT
Page 35
You can go in now, Constable. The Princess has a few minutes
before the next suitor.
Thank you.
FX: FOLLOW WOLSEY INTO:
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 36
14: INT. THRONE ROOM [CONTINUOUS]
FX: AS WOLSEY APPROACHES:
Constable Wolsey. — I’m sorry to learn of your loss.
(STOPPING AT THRONE) So am I, Princess Dirani.
Queen Peri has served the Coalition well. I will ensure that Hurn plays full tribute to her.
Thank you.
Where is Queen Peri now?
Resting in her quarters.
Tell her she is welcome to an audience with me at any time.
You’re very gracious, but my Queen is still coming to terms with her impending death. She wants news of this to be kept secret, to avoid overshadowing the ceremony.
Of course.
PHEN-TU: (SMALL VOICE, SNIVELLING, UNDER THRONE) Tell him to go away. Please...
Your Highness? Is there someone in here with us-?

Oh dear, your grief is affecting my empathy sprite. He is cowering under my throne, but he will need all his wits about him when I receive my other suitors. I’m sorry, but I will have to ask you to leave.
PHEN-TU:
MOANS
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 37
Of course, Your Highness. — Can I just ask one favour? Your suitors were in the hall when the incident happened. I should like to question them.
Certainly. I give you royal licence. Have you questioned your chief suspect yet?
Not yet, my lady. He is in the interrogation room. I intend to go there... presently.
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 38
15: INT. INTERROGATION ROOM
FX: WOLSEY BANGS FIST ON TABLE.
Talk!!!
How’s Peri?
Dying.
Oh. — Do please sit down, Constable. You’re making me nervous.
FX: CHAIR IS PULLED UP. AS WOLSEY SITS:
I had a big four-gut feeling about you, Doctor. I should have listened to one of them. What are you? Some kind of anti- monarchist sleeper agent?
You think I waited five years to kill the Queen? My goodness, that is a long-term plan.

Queen Peri has got Trimorphol in her body now, and she didn’t have it in her body before. You were sitting next to her at the banquet. Her drink, which you poured for her, contained Trimorphol. What else am I supposed to conclude?
How long has Peri got?
I don’t see why I should tell you anything. You can rot in the dungeons for all I care. Guards!
FX: DOOR OPENS.
#1: Sir?
Drag the Doctor below and lock him up.
FX: GUARDS MARCH UP TO DOCTOR.
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 39
#1: Sorry about this, Doctor. I’m sure it’s all a misunderstanding.
GRABS DOCTOR
I wish I had your optimism, Guard One.
(TO GUARDS) Don’t be too gentle about it!
#2: I’m going to have to punch you in the stomach now, Doctor, if that’s alright?
Be my guest.
FX: DOCTOR PUNCHED IN THE STOMACH.
SMALL GASP
#2: Sorry about that. Protocol.
I wouldn’t worry. I’ve had worse.
(TO GUARDS) Go!!!
FX: DOCTOR MARCHED OFF BY GUARDS. FADE.
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 40
16: INT. CELL
FX: RATTLE OF KEYS BEHIND DOOR. DOOR OPENS.
#1: Here we go. It’s not as nice as your last cell. Bit pokey.
Well, when one gets to my age, one looks to downsize.
#2: Good for you, Doc. Keep that sense of humour going.
FX: DOOR CLANGS SHUT. AS GUARDS WALK AWAY DOWN CORRIDOR:
SIGHS
(OFF) Hello? Is that somebody new?
(STARTLED) Yes. — Where are you? It’s a bit [dark.]
(OFF) Over here, chained to the wall.
FX: FOLLOW AS DOCTOR CROSSES TO OTHER SIDE OF CELL.
So you are. — Are you alright?
Oh yes. I expect they’1ll let me out soon. I am royalty, you know.
In which case, may I ask why you’re in here?
They ‘said’ I broke the terms of my intergalactic restraining order. They ‘said’ I was hiding under Queen Peri’s bed. I wasn’t, you know. I was just examining the room for booby traps.
Ah. — Prince Harcross the Ever-patient, I presume?
You’ve heard of me?
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 41
Queen Peri did mention you.
You mean, you’ve talked to Queen Peri? Actually talked?
From time to time.

You are so lucky. Tell me, have you ever heard her laugh? I’ve heard her scream and shout for her guards, but I’ve never heard her laugh before. I’ve always wondered what it sounds like. I like to imagine it to be like tinkly heavenly music. Is her laugh like music?
Ah. Well, it’s more of a snort, really. I suppose her nose is a wind instrument of sorts, so you could describe it as music.
I knew it. Like the heavenly music of my home planet, Hobril Minor.
I can’t say I’ve heard of it.

Oh, don’t apologise. If I didn’t come from it, I wouldn’t have heard of it either. It’s a nothing little place. That’s the reason why I am Ever-patient. My kingdom isn’t important enough for Queen Peri to deign to consider a royal union, but I live in hope. Could you tell her I’m still very keen?
If I ever see her again, I’1l let her know.
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 42
17: INT. CORRIDOR/ANTECHAMBER
FX: PTERATRARK AND TOCRODI WALKING.
So Tocrodi, here is my plan. I have my strategy all worked out.
You have a strategy, Baron?

Of course I do, Tocrodi. One must look on marriage as one does war. I will say, “Princess Dirani, your skin is as white as Yyrn’s milk, and your eyes are as blue and sparkling as the Crystals of the Mines of Terterra...”
From what I have noticed of the peoples of Hurn, I should have said that their skin is blue, and their eyes are white.
You're right! You have a keen eye, Tocrodi. It is good to have a medical man to give advice. — (STOPPING AS THEY ARRIVE IN
ANTECHAMBER) Here we are.
Halt!
I have an appointment.
None may possess weapons in the presence of the Princess. Do you possess a weapon?
Only my passion.
FX: BLEEP OF DETECTOR.
And a gun, according to this here weapon detector...?
(HANDING GUN OVER) And a gun. Passion AND a gun.
FX: HUGE AUTOMATED DOORS SWING OPEN.
(OFF) Enter...
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 43
Wish me luck, Tocrodi..
FX: WALKS THROUGH INTO:
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 44
18: INT. THRONE ROOM [CONTINUOUS]
FX: AS BARON WALKS UP:
Baron Pteratrark, it is good to see you.
(ARRIVING AT THRONE) And you, my Princess.
AWKWARD SILENCE
In your own time, Baron.
Oh yes! Sorry. Erm.. I have noticed that... Your — eyes are as white as Yyrn’s milk, and your skin is a blue and sparkling as the Crystals of the Mines of Terterra.
Oh Baron, you say the loveliest things.
Furthermore, allow me to wave my plumage in your direction.
Oh, that is lovely.
FX: PHEN-TU SCUTTLES UP.
PHEN-TU:
SNIFFS HIM
It looks very warm.
(DISTRACTED) Oh yes. Maybe you can use my plumage to keep you warm in bed, if you are catching my drifting.
PHEN-TU: I’m getting arrogance. A lot of arrogance.
Who is this pixie who is smelling me?
PHEN-TU: I’m tasting misogyny, with a soupgon of condescension.
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 45
This is Phen-tu, my empathy sprite. He’s here to make sure I make the right selection.
I will not put up with this sniffing of my personage!
PHEN-TU:
Now, I’m sensing irritation, I’m getting aggression— (GRABBED BY THROAT, STRANGULATED) I’m definitely getting aggression.
Baron, I will thank you to remove your fingers from my empath’s neck.
PHEN-TU:
RELEASED, SPLUTTERING
There you go — on your way, little fellow. I think I have dislodged that thing you had in your throat there.
If.. you'll excuse me, Baron, I am going to revolve my throne, so I can consult with my empath?
FX: WHIRR AS THRONE REVOLVES.
(UNDER BREATH) Here we go...
SHORT, INCOMPREHENSIBLE WHISPER, OFF
PHEN-TU:
LONGER, INCOMPREHENSIBLE WHISPER, OFF
SHORT, INCOMPREHENSIBLE WHISPER, OFF
FX: WHIRR.
I’m afraid, Baron, that Phen-Tu is not impressed with your
aura.
What?
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 46
He senses — and I think I agree — that you’re a bit of a chauvinist.
No silly little girl tells the Baron he is chauvinist! — I will now stalk angrily from this place with my cloak flapping behind me!
FX: STOMPS OFF. CROSS TO:
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 47
19: INT. ANTECHAMBER
FX: AUTOMATED DOORS SHUT BEHIND PTERATRARK.
Did it go well, Baron?
She called me a chauvinist! Me! Chauvinist! Hah!
(ARRIVING) Oh dear, Pteratrark, did it not go well? And I prayed so hard for you.
On the contrary, it went extremely well, Flitamus. I’d wish you luck, but you have your Gods working overtime for you, I’m sure.
FX: AUTOMATED DOORS OPEN.
Reverend Flitamus, the Princess is ready for you now.
(GOING INSIDE) Thank you, my son.
FX: AUTOMATED DOORS CLOSE. WOLSEY AND 2 x GUARDS WALK UP FROM
I tell you, Tocrodi, when I am King, the Reverend will be first up against the wall.
(ARRIVING) Excuse me, Baron... Can I have a word?
Oh hello, Constable, what brings you and these two proud guardians of justice and liberty here?
#1: (SOTTO) He’s talking about us, Guard Two.
#2: (SOTTO) I know!
I would like to ask you and your colleague about yesterday.
That? Flitamus and Drast started it —
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 48
I’m not interested in the fight. I want to know if you noticed anything that happened on Queen’s Peri’s table?
No, I did not.
Near her drink, specifically?
No. Did you, Tocrodi?
I can’t say I did.
Ask Flitamus when he comes out. He has lots of gods watching over him. Perhaps they saw something.
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 49
20: INT. THRONE ROOM
Reverend Flitamus, there have been rumours that should you achieve a union with me, you would convert my people to your religions on pain of death, and use them as troops in your next crusade.
Indeed, your Highness.
PAUSE
And your reaction to those rumours, Reverend Flitamus?
Beg pardon?
Do I have your assurance that there’s no danger of you doing that?
Oh, that’s a bad thing?
I would say so. Wouldn’t you?
Ah. Then let me put your fears to rest. I would not dream of doing either of those things.
PHEN-TU: (SNIFFING) I’m getting obfuscation, I’m sensing deceit...
What?
My empath seems to think you are not telling me the truth, Reverend.
How dare he..! The religion I adopted this morning strictly forbids the telling of untruths. I could no more lie to you than I could eat undressed Varnek on a Froodsay.
Then I will take your word.
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 50
Thank you, your Highness.
PHEN-TU:
SNIFFING
Your demon is still sniffing at me.
PHEN-TU: Very interesting. I’m getting a very potent aroma of contempt. Deep contempt for unbelievers.
Your Highness...
PHEN-TU:
He sees non-believers as less than nothing, and... (SNIFF) since he sees them as less than nothing, he thinks it quite legitimate within the framework of his beliefs to lie through his teeth.
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 51
21: INT. ANTECHAMBER
FX: AUTOMATED DOOR OPENS. FLITAMUS HURRIES OUT.
(TO SELF) That woman is a witch! (CALLING) Drast! Where are you?
(BEHIND) Behind you, Reverend.
(STARTING) What? — Why are you skulking in my shadow?
EY...
FX: WOLSEY & 2 x GUARDS WALKING UP FROM CORRIDOR OFF THROUGH:
Never mind. The Princess used a demonic creature to look into my soul! I will put her and this planet to the flame!
(ARRIVING) Good day to you, Reverend.

Good, Constable? What is good about today? Do you know that today is the nineteenth eve of the darkling moon, a day of utmost ominousness when the dead shall rise and kick over the dustbins of the living?
I can’t say I did.
That’s the tiresome thing about being a defender of all faiths. Every day in the calendar is horrible for one reason or another.
I should like to ask you about yesterday evening.
That? The Baron started it, and Tocrodi, of course —
As I said to the Baron, I’m really not interested in the fight. Did you notice anything odd happening near Queen Peri?
No... You, Drast?
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 52
No.
Like someone putting something in her drink?
/DRAST: No.
. Now, if you’1ll excuse me, I wish to pray to today’s God to influence the Princess’s wits in my favour. (LEAVING) Come, Drast.
FX: AS FLITAMUS & DRAST EXIT:
(MUSING) Well, that’s it. That’s everyone who was in the hall yesterday evening questioned. Looks like no-one saw the Doctor spike Queen Peri’s drink.
#1: Except us.
BEAT
What?
#2: We weren’t gonna say anything... On account of, the Doctor’s a mate and all.
#1: We did guard him for a long time. You do tend to get close. You see it a lot in our line of work.
#2: It’s like Stockholm syndrome, but in reverse. You get to feel like the prisoner is looking after you.
So you’re saying...
#1: Well, we did. See him, we mean. During the fight.
#2: Plain as day. A little white pill.
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 53
#1: Yeah, a white pill.
FX: LINKING MUSIC.
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 54
22: INT. PERI’S QUARTERS
They both saw the Doctor?
No doubt about it. They had no reason to lie.
My God... And you’ve talked to the Doctor?
I have.
Well, what did he say?
Not a lot.
FX: REVERSE ECHO INTO:
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 55
23: INT. CELL [FLASHBACK]
FX: DOOR OPENS.
(STRIDING IN) Alright, you.
& HARCROSS: Who, me?
(FX: WALKING TO HARCROSS) Him! — Out you go, weirdo.
FX: JINGLE OF KEYS. AS WOLSEY UNLOCKS HARCROSS’S CHAINS:
My time’s up, then?
I don’t want to see you back in this castle until the ceremony’s over.
(AS HE LEAVES) Don’t forget, Doctor, if you see Queen Peri, put in a good word for me...
I don’t think my word holds much sway at the moment...
FX: DOOR CLANGS SHUT BEHIND HARCROSS.
. does it, Constable?
I have witnesses who say that you poisoned Queen Peri’s drink. (BEAT) Can you explain that?
I can’t.
Simple question, Doctor. Did you put something in Queen Peri’s drink?
I.. refuse to answer that...
On the grounds that it might incriminate you.
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 56
On the grounds that I can’t say anything. Not yet.
Oh, come on...
I just can’t, Constable. If I say the wrong thing now, the results could be catastrophic.
You’re mad. Utterly mad.

Humour the madman, then. — I just can’t tell you anything that’s going to happen in the next few hours, because for me, it’s already happened. All I can tell you is, there’s going to be another murder. And then you will come and see me here. And then, and only then, will I be able to help you.
You must be joking. I will never come here again. Goodbye, Doctor. When I see you next, it’1ll be when your head’s on the chopping block.
FX: REVERSE ECHO OUT INTO:
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 57
24: INT. PERI’S QUARTERS
. That was it. I’m sorry, your Majesty. I hate to say this, but this is how Yrcanos described the Doctor to me. Insane, traitorous. Kept swapping sides...
It’s not who the Doctor is. Maybe it’s a test. I have to talk to him.
Absolutely not.
You can’t stop me. [I’m your Queen. ]
(INTERRUPTING) Yes. You’re my Queen, and I’m your head of security. That man down in the dungeon is the only suspect in your murder. It’s for your own safety.
Even though I’ve got a day left to [live.]
(ON TANNOY) Attention. The choice has been made. Suitors will report to the throne room. The successful applicants will remain, the others will be sent home.
(GETTING UP) I must go to the throne room.
Ma’am! You’re in no condition [to go].

Have some respect for my wishes, Wolsey! I am your — (BREAKS OFF, CALM) Trimorphol doesn’t have any serious effect until the moment of death. That’s the point of Trimorphol. That’s why they call it “secret assassin”, isn’t it?
I believe so, Ma’am.
So don’t worry. I’m perfectly capable of going up a few flights of stairs.
FX: SHE EXITS. FADE.
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 58
25: INT. ANTECHAMBER
FX: HUSHED CHATTER OF ASSEMBLED DELEGATES. CHIME.
(ON TANNOY) Attention, delegates! Princess Dirani has made her choice. Please assemble outside the throne room immediately.
FX: AS PERI WALKS UP:
Ah! — Greetings to you, Queen Peri. So glad you could join us. I heard you were ill. Nothing serious, I hope?
Just an upset stomach.
I sympathise. The cuisine here is very impure.
What do we do now?
We wait.
We have been waiting fifteen minutes already! No-one keeps Baron Pteratrark waiting. Tell them, Tocrodi.
No-one keeps the Baron waiting.
The doors can be opened by the Princess, and the Princess alone.
(REPEATED MESSAGE, ON TANNOY) Attention, delegates! Princess Dirani has made her choice. Please assemble outside the throne room immediately.
I wish someone would turn that annoying voice off. It is most grating to my sensors.
I’ve had enough of this.
FX: BANGS ON DOORS.
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 59
Open up there, will you!
Baron! Show some respect!
One moment. These doors, they are not sealed!
FX: PUSHES DOORS OPEN. ALL WALK THROUGH INTO:
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 60
26: INT. THRONE ROOM [CONTINUOUS]
FX: THEY ENTER.
It’s empty. The room is empty.
What’s going on? Is this some kind of joke? I dislike jokes, don’t I, Tocrodi?
The Baron dislikes jokes.
They are gone. Spirited away. Surely this is some kind of miracle.
Always with the miracles! Can’t you ever...
FX: WHIRR OF REVOLVING THRONE.
What is that noise?
The throne. It’s revolving. — (STEPPING UP TO THRONE) Who’s that? There’s someone on the throne.
(STORMING FORWARD) Get back, everybody. Let me deal with this.
Is it the Princess?
No, it’s not the Princess. It’s Phen-Tu. The empath.
PHEN-TU: (WEAKLY) Constable...
He’s been stabbed.
PHEN-TU: I’m sensing... sensing... (GURGLES; DIES)
He’s dead.
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 61
Constable? Did he say Constable?
Of course he did. He was talking to me.
I only find it interesting... because that is your knife, is it not, embedded in his belly?
Don’t be ridicul[ous] — (BREAKS OFF) But —
It is your knife, Constable!
Yes, I’m afraid it is.
FADE.
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 62
27: INT. CELL
FX: DOOR UNLOCKED. CREAKS OPEN.
#1: (AT DOOR) In you go, Constable, sir.
#2: (AT DOOR) Very sorry.
Bah!
FX: THEY THRUST WOLSEY IN. DOOR CLANGS SHUT.
You, Doctor! — You knew this was going to happen!
Would it annoy you if I said ‘correct’?
Yes. (LONG PAUSE) Tell me, then, O oracle of the future. What happens now?
I’m afraid we’ve just reached the limits of my inside knowledge.
Very convenient.
So we'll just have to use our intelligence instead, won’t we?
If you say so.
Let’s recap what we know. Yrcanos was murdered with Trimorphol. As Queen Peri has been. Will be. You have been framed for murder, Princess Dirani is missing and Phen-Tu the empath has been killed.
It’s all insane. There is nothing to link any of those events.
Oh there is, we just haven’t found it yet. But I’m sure you and I together will discover the connection very soon.
THE WIDOW’S ASSASSIN by Nev Fountain (FINAL) Page 63
I thought you’d reached the limits of your inside information?
The limits of my inside information, yes. The limits of my intelligence. Never.
FX: CLANG.
